svg.title: Comparison of pyramids SMIL
svg.desc: Comparison of approximate profiles of some pyramidal or near-pyramidal buildings by CMG Lee. Where the base is rectangular, the longer side is shown. Dotted lines indicate original heights, where data is available. Hover over a label or profile to highlight it, and click the (i) icon for its Wikipedia article.

text.tspan: Xi'an, China, c.210 BC, 47 m (was 76 m)
Pyongyang, North Korea, under construction, 330 m
San Francisco, United States of America, 1972, 260 m
Giza, Egypt, c.2560 BC, 138.8 m (was 146.5 m)
Giza, Egypt, c.2530 BC, 136.4 m (was 143.5 m)
Las Vegas, United States of America, 1993, 111 m
Meidum, Egypt, c.2600 BC, 65 m (was 93.5 m)
